bibl.title: Salfest A. Sylvester v. Stener S. Wenaas. Order of Show Cause
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.ab: In the Matter of the application of Salfest A. Sylvester for a writ of Habeas Corpus.
div1.p: On reading and filing the petition of Salfest A. Sylvester for a writ of habeas corpus herein, and it appearing therefrom that said petitioner is restrained of his liberty against his consent by Sheriff of King County, Washington. Stener S. Wenaas and A.T. Van De Vanter, it is therefore hereby ordered that the said Stener S. Wenaas and A.T. Van de Vanter, show cause to this court forthwith at its court room in the city of Seattle, King County, Washington, why said writ of habeas corpus so applied for should not be granted and isssued, and pending the hearing on said order to show cause and the further order of this court, the said Stener S. Wenaas and A. T. Van de Vanter, and each of them, are hereby restrained from removing the said petitioner from his present place of custody, except that they are hereby required and ordered to produce his body before this court at the hearing on said order to show cause.
Done in open court this 26th day of June, 1899.
div1.ab:
United States of America, District of Washington.
ss.
div1.p: I, A. Reeves Ayres Clerk of the Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Washington, do hereby certify that I have compared the foregoing copy with the original order to show cause in the foregoing entitled cause, now on file and of record in my office at Seattle, and that the same is a true and perfect transcript of said original and of the whole thereof.
Witness my hand and the seal of said Court, this JUN 26 1899 day of A. D. 189
div1.ab: A. Reeves Ayres Clerk By H M Matthew Deputy.
In the matter of the application of S A Sylvester for writ of habeas corpus
Return to order to show cause
FILED IN THE U. S. Circuit Court, DIST. OF WASHINGTON.
JUN 26 1899 A. REEVES AYRES, clerk R M Hopkins Dep.
